alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 9:48AM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... West Hobolochitto Creek Near McNeil affecting Pearl River County. Bogue Chitto River Near Bush affecting St. Tammany Parish. Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown affecting Walthall and Pike Counties. Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting Hancock, St. Tammany and Pearl River Counties. Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Hancock, Washington, St. Tammany and Pearl River Counties. For the Bogue Chitto River...including Tylertown, Franklinton, Bush...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Pearl River...including Bogalusa, Pearl River...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Hobolochitto Creek...including McNeil...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Chitto River Near Bush. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The access road upstream of the bridge will flood. The river will leave the main channel on the left bank below the bridge flooding woodlands on either side of Louisiana Highway 21. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Sunday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 12.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 10/26/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
